clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Motivational Interview and Education Based on Watson Human Care Model in Adults Receiving Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Motivational Interview and Education Based on Watson Human Care Model on Adherence to Treatment, Satisfaction and Quality of Life in Adults Receiving Hemodialysis Treatment

brief_summary.textblock:
- Motivational interviewing and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on increasing adherence to fluid restriction in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.
- Motivational interviewing and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on increasing adherence to diet in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.
- Motivational interviewing and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on increasing adherence to medication management in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.
- Motivational interviewing and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on increasing satisfaction in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.
- Motivational interviewing and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on increasing quality of life in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: In the study, which will last for 4 months, the patients in the intervention group will receive pre-test and Motivational Interview and Education Based on Watson Human Care Model at the first interview. Patients will receive Motivational Interview Based on Watson Human Care Model at second interview after one month. Patients will receive Motivational Interview Based on Watson Human Care Model at third interview after one month. In the fourth interview and post-test after one month, patients will receive Motivational Interview Based on Watson Human Care Model. Finally, motivational interview and education based on Watson Human Care Model have an effect on adherence to treatment, satisfaction and quality of life in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is a randomized controlled study

primary_outcome.measure: Has an effect on improving adherence to fluid control
primary_outcome.description: Fluid Control in Hemodialysis Patients Scale: In this study, the scale had 24 items and 3 point likert scale. It was used to identify knowledge, behaviors, and attitudes of hemodialysis (HD) patients adherence to fluid. The score range of scale is 24-72. A higher score indicates a higher adherence to fluid control. The scale was developed in Turkey.

primary_outcome.measure: Has an effect on improving adherence to diet
primary_outcome.description: Scale for Dietary Behaviors in Hemodialysis Patients: : In this study, the scale had 13 items and 5 point likert scale. It was used to determine behaviors of hemodialysis patients adherence to diet. The score range of scale is 13-65. A higher score indicates a higher adherence to diet. The scale was developed in Turkey.

primary_outcome.measure: Has an effect on improving adherence to drug
primary_outcome.description: Modified Morisky Scale: In this study, the scale had 6 items. Patients should answer yes or no. It was used to determine motivation and knowledge of hemodialysis patients adherence to drug. If total score have 0-1, this show low motivation in motivation questions. If total score have 2-3, this show high motivation in motivation questions. If total score have 0-1, this show low knowledge in knowledge questions. If total score have 2-3, this show high knowledge in knowledge questions. Turkish version of the questionnaire was used.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess adherence participation in dialysis sessions
primary_outcome.description: Hemodialysis Session Participation Form : In order to determine the attendance of hemodialysis sessions, the researcher prepared a monthly hemodialysis session participation form covering four follow-up periods.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine patients' satisfaction of caring
primary_outcome.description: Watson Caritas Patient Score: it used to determine the patient's experience of caring. The 5 items of the WCPS emerged from the Watson theory of 10 Caritas Processes as universals of caring phenomenon and foundational indicators of human caring. Response options for each item range from 1 (never) to 7 (always).

primary_outcome.measure: To determine patients' satisfaction of interviewing
primary_outcome.description: Motivational Interview Evaluation Form: In the motivational interview evaluation form, there are three questions such as five-point likert scale to evaluate the satisfaction of the interview, the question of evaluating the inadequacies of the interview and the open-ended question to be indicated by the patient if there are any inadequacies.

primary_outcome.measure: Has an effect on improving quality of life
primary_outcome.description: Kidney Disease Quality of Life Instrument 36 ıtem:it is a 36-item HRQOL survey with five subscales. The KDQOL™-36 contains 5 subscales: the Physical Component Summary (PCS), Mental Component Summary (MCS), Burden of Kidney Disease (BKD), Symptoms and Problems of Kidney Disease (SPKD), and Effects of Kidney Disease (EKD). The score range of scale is 0-100. A higher score indicates a higher quality of life. Turkish version of the questionnaire was used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were receive hemodialysis at Akdeniz University Hospital Hemodialysis unit
- Patients who had 1 and above from Diet And Fluid Non‐Adherence Questionnaire total score
- Patients who had 0 or 1 score from 1.2. and 6. questions or 3., 4. and 5. questions in the Modified Morisky Scale.
- Patients who receiving Hemodialysis treatment for at least 3 months
- Patients who were over 18 years of age,
- Patients who had orientation of individual, place and time
- Patients who were literate
- Patients who no barriers to written or verbal communication
- Patients who agree to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had psychiatric disease
- Patients who had diagnosis of malignancy
